intro: Hieracium bosniaphilum, commonly known as the Bosnian hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and basal rosettes of narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow ray flowers surrounded by pale yellow disk flowers, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is native to the Balkan Peninsula and thrives in grassy areas and disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain environments.
